page.title: 14PLAISH COTTAGE COMPLEX
page.content: There is a very attractive complex of stone buildings surrounding a cobblestoned courtyard in the wooded hamlet of Plaish. Most of these buildings were originally estate workers cottages for the Elizabethan Manor House - Plaish Hall. Now two sides of this square have been converted into one house,one side is still the original stables and the 4th side is a terrace of 3 cottages. These fell into disrepair,then were restored for holiday letting but are now privately owned. Many 100-year old elm trees surrounding Plaish Cottage have now succumbed to Dutch Elm Disease, opening up a view of Bowman Hill Coppice and the trout pool in the Hughley Brook running through the valley.
